alert.note: Alert for Steuben (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 8:37PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Steuben, southern Hillsdale, northern Williams and northwestern Fulton Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 836 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Reading, or 11 miles northwest of Montpelier, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Brief heavy downpours will occur with this storm. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Pioneer and Holiday City around 850 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Fayette. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Indiana near mile marker 156. Interstate 80 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 27. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
